cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest, expected to turn northwest and approach the central Louisiana coast, then move inland toward Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, LA (Tropical Storm and Storm-Surge Watches)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coastline with effects extending east to the Florida Panhandle and westward toward the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands could bring sustained winds of 25–35 kt with higher gusts to the upper Texas coast Friday night through Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft above normal tide levels is possible along the upper Texas coast, but significant inundation is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain are possible with locally higher totals if feeder bands persist near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents in the near-shore Gulf waters; occasional squalls reducing visibility and affecting vessel handling.
